Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hesitant \Hes"i*tant\, a. [L. haesitans, p. pr. of haesitare: cf. F. h['e]sitant. See {Hesitate}.] 1. Not prompt in deciding or acting; hesitating. [1913 Webster]
2. Unready in speech. --Baxter. [1913 Webster]

hesitant adj 1: lacking decisiveness of character; unable to act or decide quickly or firmly; "stood irresolute waiting for some inspiration" [syn: {hesitating}, {irresolute}] 2: acting with uncertainty or hesitance or lack of confidence; "a groping effort to understand" [syn: {groping}]
